name: Vietnamese Shrimp Egg Rolls (Chả Giò Cuốn Tôm)
description: A super simple Vietnamese appetizer. Whole shrimp, simply marinated then rolled in egg wrappers and deep-fried. It's fancy. It's delicious, and a guaranteed crowd-pleaser.
keywords: vietnamese shrimp egg rolls, vietnamese shrimp egg roll, shrimp egg rolls, shrimp spring roll, shrimp spring roll recipe, crispy shrimp egg roll, crispy shrimp egg roll, vietnamese appetizer, vietnamese crispy spring roll appetizer, vietnamese crispy egg roll appetizer, how to make vietnamese shrimp egg roll appetizer, how to make vietnamese shrimp spring roll appetizer, shrimp egg rolls, how to make shrimp egg rolls, vietnamese shrimp egg roll recipe, easy homemade shrimp egg roll, easy homemade shrimp spring roll, shrimp egg roll tutorial, how to wrap shrimp egg roll, how to wrap shrimp spring roll, shrimp egg rolls recipe, authentic shrimp egg rolls recipe, authentic vietnamese shrimp egg roll recipe, shrimp egg roll recipe, shrimp egg rolls recipe, cha gio cuon tom, cha gio tom, Chả Giò Cuốn Tôm, Chả Giò Tôm, vietnamese home cooking recipes
recipeIngredient: 1 lb headless shrimp (peel, devein and leave tails on to make a "handle")
1 packet spring roll/lumpia /egg roll wrappers (I typically use Menlo brand)
Bottled sweet chili dipping sauce or make your own
recipeInstructions: In a medium-sized bowl, add the shrimp, oyster sauce and sugar. Toss to combine.
In a small bowl, beat the egg with a fork and set aside. If you don't have an egg, you can also mix 1 tablespoon tapioca starch with 2 tablespoons cold water.

See the instructional picture above for reference. Cut the stack of egg roll wrappers in half at a diagonal. Pull apart slowly to separate into individual sheets. Place a shrimp on the wrapper with the tail sticking out. Gently roll up. At the midway point, pull the wrapper corner down to cover the shrimp. Continue rolling up. Brush egg wash (or tapioca starch/water mixture) on the top corner to seal.

Deep fry the shrimp egg rolls at 375°F without overcrowding (about 2 minutes per batch or until golden brown). Transfer fried shrimp egg rolls from the oil to a wire rack or a plate lined with paper towels to absorb the excess oil. Serve immediately with a side of sweet chili dipping sauce for best results.
